definitions: To look at all parts of (something) carefully in order to detect some feature.
To pass a beam of X-rays or other radiation over (something) in order to obtain an image or information.
To read (data) into a computer using a scanner.
To look quickly but not thoroughly.
To analyze the meter of a line of verse.
examples: He scanned the horizon for ships.
The doctor scanned the patient's brain.
She scanned the document into the computer.
The students learned to scan poetry.
